problem_types.name: Ising Model
problem_types.formulation: H = -sum_{ij} J_ij * sigma_i * sigma_j - sum_i h_i * sigma_i

problem_types.name: QUBO
problem_types.formulation: minimize x^T Q x where x in {0, 1}^n

parameters.Q: Upper triangular or symmetric matrix (n x n)

problem_types.reduction: Standard QUBO-to-Ising: sigma = 2x - 1, J_ij = -Q_ij/4, h_i = -Q_ii/2 - sum_j Q_ij/4

problem_types.name: 3-SAT / k-SAT
problem_types.formulation: Satisfy conjunction of disjunctive clauses: (l1 OR l2 OR l3) AND ...
problem_types.variables: x_i in {True, False}, literals l in {x_i, NOT x_i}

parameters.clauses: List of clauses in CNF format

problem_types.reduction: Each clause becomes penalty terms in the Ising Hamiltonian. Unsatisfied clauses increase energy.
problem_types.complexity: NP-complete (3-SAT). Phase transition at alpha = num_clauses/num_vars = 4.27

phase_transition.description: Sharp transition from almost-always satisfiable (alpha < 4.27) to almost-never satisfiable (alpha > 4.27). Hardest instances cluster near this threshold.

problem_types.name: Max-Cut
problem_types.formulation: Partition graph nodes into two sets to maximize edges between sets
problem_types.reduction: Antiferromagnetic Ising: J = -A (negative adjacency). Minimizing Ising energy maximizes cut.

problem_types.name: TSP (via QUBO)
problem_types.formulation: Find shortest Hamiltonian cycle through n cities
problem_types.variables: x_{i,t} = 1 if city i is visited at time t

parameters.distance_matrix: Pairwise distances between cities (n x n)

problem_types.reduction: Convert to QUBO using one-hot encoding with penalty constraints for valid tours. Then QUBO-to-Ising.

problem_types.name: Graph Coloring (via QUBO)
problem_types.formulation: Assign colors to graph nodes such that no adjacent nodes share a color
problem_types.variables: x_{i,c} = 1 if node i gets color c
problem_types.reduction: Convert to QUBO using one-hot encoding (exactly one color per node) with conflict penalties.

ising_universality.description: Any combinatorial optimization problem can be reduced to finding the ground state of an Ising Hamiltonian. This makes the Ising model a universal substrate for NP-hard optimization.
ising_universality.reference: Lucas, A. (2014). Ising formulations of many NP problems. Frontiers in Physics, 2, 5.
